titleStmt.title: Dissertatio de pace, &c. Or, A discourse touching the peace & concord of the Church. Wherein is elegantly and acutely argued, that not so much a bad opinion, as a bad life, excludes a Christian out of the kingdom of heaven; and that the things necessary to be known for the attainment of salvation, are very few and easie: and finally, that those, who pass amongst us under the name of hereticks, are notwithstanding to be tolerated.
Dissertatio de pace. English
titleStmt.author: Przypkowski, Samuel, 1592-1670.

titleStmt.title: Dissertatio de pace, &c. Or, A discourse touching the peace & concord of the Church. Wherein is elegantly and acutely argued, that not so much a bad opinion, as a bad life, excludes a Christian out of the kingdom of heaven; and that the things necessary to be known for the attainment of salvation, are very few and easie: and finally, that those, who pass amongst us under the name of hereticks, are notwithstanding to be tolerated.
Dissertatio de pace. English
titleStmt.author: Przypkowski, Samuel, 1592-1670.
Biddle, John, 1615-1662,

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Ja: Cottrel, for Rich. Moone, at the seven stars in Paul's Church-yard.,

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Przypkowski, Samuel. Dissertatio de pace.
Translation sometimes attributed to John Biddle.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
